  "title": "Infrastructure Engineer (Cloud)",
  "description": "Layer3 is one of the fastest growing network and security infrastructure companies in West Africa, providing award-winning services, including managed and cloud services, network security, IT infrastructure management, virtualization and mobile device management solutions. Our unique model integrates best-of-breed technologies from global leaders such as Juniper Networks, Blue Coat, Polycom, AirWatch, F5, Extreme Networks and VMware, coupled with our next-generation metro fiber networks, to offer unparalleled services and after sales support to some of the most demanding customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Infrastructure Engineer (Cloud)

Job Location: Lagos &amp; Abuja, Nigeria
Department: Cloud / Infrastructure
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Team Lead, Cloud &amp; Product Manager
Grade Level: Mid Level

Job Purpose


	The Infrastructure Engineer will be responsible for designing, building, and testing the private cloud infrastructure components comprising compute, storage, etc., and ensuring the underlying architecture supports business needs.


Duties and Responsibilities


	Design and architect end-to-end validated solutions representing real-world cloud provider implementations.
	Function as the technical product expert for specific cloud provider solution areas.
	Collaborate with the cloud business unit to review functional specifications and provide feedback on releases and features.
	Design, implement, and manage scalable and secure cloud infrastructure across public, private, and hybrid environments.
	Administer and support Linux-based systems ensuring high availability, performance, and security.
	Deploy, configure, and manage OpenStack deployments such as Virtuozzo-based virtualization and container environments.
	Develop and maintain Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using tools like Terraform, Ansible, or similar.
	Collaborate with DevOps teams to automate deployment pipelines, CI/CD processes, and monitoring.
	Create and maintain custom cloud product offerings tailored to business needs.
	Monitor system performance, conduct capacity planning, and perform root cause analysis.
	Implement and enforce security best practices across cloud and virtualized environments.
	Provide expertise in containerization technologies including Virtuozzo, Docker, and Kubernetes.
	Integrate third-party services and APIs to enhance cloud platform capabilities.
	Work with cross-functional teams to define cloud strategies and operational procedures.
	Ensure compliance with organizational standards and regulatory requirements (ISO, GDPR).
	Document system configurations, processes, and architectural decisions.


Qualification and Experience


	First Degree in Engineering or Computer Science.
	3&ndash;5 years of experience as an Infrastructure Engineer.
	Strong expertise with OpenStack and virtualization solutions (VMware, Proxmox).
	Knowledge of storage solutions (iSCSI, NAS, SAN), hyper-converged solutions, and backup/disaster recovery tools (Commvault, Veeam, Netbackup, Acronis).
	Proficiency in Linux system administration (CentOS, Ubuntu, RHEL).
	Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP, Digital Ocean).
	Experience with DevOps practices, Bash scripting, and monitoring tools (Prometheus, Grafana, Zabbix).
	Strong problem-solving and collaboration skills.


Key Skills Acquired:


	Cloud Infrastructure

	Monitoring Tools (Prometheus, Grafana, Zabbix)
	Bash scripting
	AWS
	Azure
	GCP

Electrical Technician Job at Olam Sanyo Foods Limited




        
    

        
        Olam Sanyo Foods Limited wasa Nigerian joint venture between Olam International and Sanyo Foods Co. Ltd, formed to manufacture and distribute instant noodles and other packaged food products across Nigeria and sub-Saharan Africa.The partnership combined Olam's extensive distribution network in Africa with Sanyo Foods' expertise in noodle technology and manufacturing.The company was a significant player in the Nigerian instant noodles market, known for its "Cherie" brand, which included products .

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical Technician

Job Location: Apapa, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilties
     

            
    




	Installation & Assembly: Install, assemble, and test electrical wiring, control systems, panels, and equipment.
	Maintenance & Repair: Perform routine inspections, preventative maintenance, and corrective repairs on electrical systems and machinery.
	Troubleshooting: Diagnose and fix malfunctioning equipment using specialized tools like voltmeters, ammeters, and thermal scanners.
	Documentation: Read and interpret blueprints, schematics, and technical diagrams.
	Safety & Compliance: Ensure all work adheres to safety standards and electrical codes,inspecting components like transformers and breakers.
	Calibration: Calibrate instruments and systems for optimal performance.
	Reporting: Log services, report progress, and communicate repair timelines.


Qualiications


	Interested candidates should possess an OND / HND / B.Eng Degree with 3 - 5 years of work experience.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: joy.idika@olamnet.com and oyekunle.joseph@olamnet.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
Or
Submit applications in person at:
Olam Sanyo Foods Limited,
53, Mobil Siding road,
Apapa, Lagos.

Note


	The applicant must resident within Apapa, Ijora Badia and Orile Iganmu area
	For more enquiries, Contact Phone No: 08067001155.

  "description": "FairMoney is building the leading mobile bank for emerging markets. We started with a digital microcredit application on Android, and currently roll out additional financial services (current account, savings, debit card) while expanding the product to Western Africa and South-East Asia.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Head of Sales (Retail Banking)&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

About the Role


	The Head of Sales is a senior leadership role responsible for building and driving FairMoney&#39;s retail and business sales strategy across Nigeria. The role will focus on growing adoption of FairMoney&#39;s financial products through a strong, structured sales organization covering both B2C and B2B segments.
	This position will lead the development of an in-house retail sales function that manages and scales direct sales activities, including agency-led acquisition
	. The Head of Sales will be accountable for sales performance across key products such as Current Accounts, Savings, Transaction Accounts, Loans and Debit Cards, while also supporting B2B partnerships and business acquisition.


Responsibilities


	Build, lead, and scale a high-performing retail sales organization across Nigeria
	Set up and manage an in-house sales team responsible for overseeing direct sales and agency-driven acquisition
	Drive B2C offline sales growth across FairMoney&#39;s core retail products
